revised_title: The Critical Temperature of Freezing and Its Effects on Living Muscle
tldr: The author investigates the effects of freezing on living muscle, specifically the critical temperature at which irreversible damage occurs. They find that the critical temperature for muscle is around -1.5°C, below which the muscle loses its osmotic properties and irritability. The study also shows that the rate of thawing can affect the degree of damage caused by freezing.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
